name: Grandma's Ground Beef Casserole
author: LaDonna Langwell
summary: As the title suggests, this was my Grandmother's recipe. I've tweaked the amount of cheese and sour cream depending on what I've got in the fridge and it always turns out great! My mother has suggested this was made up as a way to use up ingredients in the fridge.
ingredients: ½ cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, or more to taste
directions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease
Mix sugar, salt, garlic salt and tomato sauce into ground beef; simmer until flavors blend, about 20 minutes
Remove from heat, cover skillet, and cool to room temperature
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook egg noodles in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 5 minutes
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix sour cream, cream cheese, and onion in a bowl
Scoop half the noodles into the prepared casserole dish; top with half the sour cream mixture
Spoon half the ground beef mixture atop sour cream layer
Bake in the preheated oven until Cheddar cheese has browned, 25 to 30 minutes
